intro: Strychnos leenhoutsii, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that contain the seeds, which are often dispersed by animals. It is adapted to dry conditions and can thrive in well-drained soils. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
